cyclone.name: PETER
cyclone.current_location: about 670 miles E of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: continues WNW, expected to pass north of the northern Leeward Islands and Puerto Rico before turning north-northwest toward the open western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall anticipated – closest passage north of Puerto Rico

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico are within the area of possible impacts from outer bands
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of gusty winds possible in squalls; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at San Juan (≤20 kt most probable).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor swell of 2–4 ft and dangerous surf/rip currents; no significant surge inundation expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may drop 1–3 inches, producing localized urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents along north-facing beaches; possible lightning in squalls.
